main event: Multiple observations of unidentified glowing oblong objects were reported over Andrews Air Force Base from various military personnel on 18 November 1948.
interesting points: The objects conducted evasive maneuvers, climbing vertically and diving; Observers described the objects as having no wings, showing extreme maneuverability; The objects were sighted at altitudes between 1700 and 7500 feet; Some reports indicated the glowing objects varied in speed from 40 to 600 mph; Two different pilots attempted to pursue the objects in F-6 aircraft, but the objects easily evaded capture.
sighted object: Oblong, glowing objects with no wings or exhaust
witness description: Military officers including 2d Lt Kenwood W. Jackson, 2d Lt Henry G. Combs, S/Sgt John J. Kushner, and others
